sentences.sContent: You don’t earn much money being a nurse.
He did all sorts of jobs to earn a living.
I was the only person in the house who was earning.
sentences.sCn: 我是家里唯一上班挣钱的人。

sentences.sContent: She was earning good money at the bank.
sentences.sCn: 她在银行工作，收入不错。

sentences.sContent: Chris will pay – he’s earning a fortune.
sentences.sCn: 克里斯会付款的，他在挣大钱。

sentences.sContent: ...Shouldering more of the workload may not earn you that promotion...
...Students earn their bachelor of science in nursing in a year...
...One advantage of sharing is that owners earn money from renting out items not made full use of...
...Those with a doctoral degree earn nearly 3...
...The peacefulness of cross-country skiing is the kind you earn by effort...
..."I'll earn more than my dad!" he boasts...

synos.tran: 赚，赚得；获得，挣得；使得到；博得

trans.tranOther: to receive a particular amount of money for the work that you do
